alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 7:10PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fort Bend County through 730 PM CDT... At 709 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Sienna Plantation, or near Missouri City. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea to half inch size hail along with locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Western Pearland, southeastern Sugar Land, Missouri City, Stafford, Fresno, First Colony, Arcola, Sienna Plantation, Riverstone, Fort Bend Houston and Fifth Street. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
